definition: office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: The peace talks reached a deadlock and nothing could be decided.
sentences.chinese: 和平談判陷入僵局，無法做出任何決定。

sentences.english: It’s also a great icebreaker for meetings with new clients.
sentences.chinese: 它也是會見新客戶打開僵局的法寶。

sentences.english: So far the stalemate between the Bucks and the Yi camp continues.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，雄鹿隊和易之隊之間的僵局還在繼續。

sentences.english: The best way to recruit scientists would be to break the development log-jam.
sentences.chinese: 招募科學家的最好辦法是打破開發僵局。

sentences.english: They were hopelessly deadlocked in almost total differences of opinion and outlook.
sentences.chinese: 他們絕望地陷於意見和觀點完全分歧的僵局之中。

sentences.english: What worries me most is the political gridlock in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 我最爲擔憂的是華盛頓的政治僵局。

sentences.english: It is unclear how the House and Senate can resolve the impasse.
sentences.chinese: 目前不清楚衆議院和參議院如何打破這個僵局。

sentences.english: The Jazz needed someone to stop him, stop what he was doing to their future.
sentences.chinese: 爵士需要有人站出來去防住巴倫，去挽救球隊的僵局。

sentences.english: We need someone to break the ice.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要有人打破這種僵局。

sentences.english: But they eventually broke the deadlock when Andreas Ottl scored on 50 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 但拜仁還是打破了僵局，奧特爾在第50分鐘進球了。

sentences.english: Dynamiting the log jam seemed to be the only solution.
sentences.chinese: 打破僵局似乎是惟一的解決辦法。

sentences.english: How to break the ice in a gridlocked negotiation is an art indeed.
sentences.chinese: 如何打破談判僵局確實是一門學問。

sentences.english: A limited company usually reaches a deadlock because of it enclosed characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 有限責任公司因其封閉型特徵而致公司僵局易發生。

sentences.english: We can only make minor concessions, but it might break the deadlock.
sentences.chinese: 我們只能做些較小的讓步，但這就可能打破僵局。

sentences.english: If there is a deadlock, refer the issue to the National Assembly.
sentences.chinese: 如果出現僵局，議題會提交到國民大會。

sentences.english: NATO, still deadlocked by internal disputes, is not in charge.
sentences.chinese: 這廂北約，則由於內部糾紛仍陷入僵局，也做不了主。

definition: to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
a two-man saw/fig. to-and-fro between two sides
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
